name: asherdan
text: A comment left by asherdan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ezcmac, riotdejaneiro, mikeronomicon, StoatLad, VeniVidiEffluxi, dismas, DeimosRising, Catachresis, mercuri0us, trisha, regrepnsnefpoh, hellsfruition, luasn, SoManyWhales, luckypyjamas, lk, regrepsnefpoh, anewcede, Afkpuz, usversusthem, benfromtenn, littlefatdog, nphares, stormagnet)

name: xud
text: People really talk like that too yo

name: chaesar
text:
That is just Onstad's Stanford vocabulary working itself. If you don't use it you lose it.

Uncle Culpepper describes thirst like its a gunshot wound.

name: hellofyellin
text:
Man, toothsome is such a good word.

Sounds like you should be saying it whilst drinking a mint julep and sitting on a broken-down cotton gin.

"My, a fresh biscuit would be mighty toothsome at this juncture."
Something like that.

name: redheron
text:
Words are great. And I'm ridiculously pleased by the idea of a vocabulary being a thing with a sort of mind of it's own.

Words are an interesting animal.

*giggle*

name: dusty
text: Most of the time when people try to use big words they just end up making a mess of it, often getting further from their real meaning. Here he's actually used them to make the imagery much more clear and precise, which in theory is the purpose of using more obscure, and ideally more carefully chosen words.

name: senseihollywood
text: Colonel Sanders, meet Foghorn Leghorn...

name: stuart
text: FIGHT!

name: rowboat
text: Foghorn Leghorn isn't real. He'd lose.

name: woodenteeth
text: Ah, but then Foghorn can never actually die. The Quandry!

name: stuart
text: nobody points out this would be the founder of a chain of places for eating chicken vs. a chicken

name: woodenteeth
text: Foghorn was a Rooster! No roasting the roosters red rocket.

name: digdugz
text: I bought a chicken with a ding-a-ling

name: vulpes-aurum
text: Chubby for the reference.

name: dracer2
text: In Australia there is a major fast food chicken chain called Red Rooster.

name: woodenteeth
text: I am from that country. Please don't point out the holes in my argument.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Yes, he has other holes where your pointed finger can...man you know what? fuck this

name: woodenteeth
text: You tried. That's important.

name: buttermoths
text: Finish him, I say!

name: djwhiterabbit
text: Perspicacious!

name: epicurus
text: I have a great fondness for Uncle Culpepper's dialogue. I have said Panel 5 to people a few times with amuzing results.

name: cheeks_jd
text: dude it seems like you say a line from every single comic you've commented on.

name: poostick
text: zing!

name: epicurus
text: You know, reading back through, it is true and it is kind of sad. I am apparently incapable of writing my own dialogue.

name: woodenteeth
text: Onstad just following you round with an auto-cue, which is basically a laptop hog tied with rope round his waist. Constantly walking backwards... here comes that girl you've always liked "live in 4, 3, 2 - "

name: epicurus
text: This would make an awesome tv show. Or at leas6 a plot for a crappy guest comic. Chris: call me.

name: woodenteeth
text: Man... knowing that Chris writes all your lines... well it lends this particular comment quite a large slathering of hilarity!

name: farqussus
text: You write your dialogue? How do you get other people to say their lines?

name: woodenteeth
text: I would imagine with a gun and a smile.

name: epicurus
text: Photos of gagged relatives and a finger across my lips, along with a raised eyebrow, as if to say "Play along now, and say nice things about my dick!"

name: anzio
text: I have noticed that when you introduce someone to Achewood, they tend to become just infatuated with the dialogue to the point it replaces they're own natural dialogue. This awesome at first, but then it seems as if this friend can't do anything but speak in Achewood dialogue. Then things get annoying.

name: evolume
text: how many dear nephew's have you?

name: evolume
text: oh panel 5. i can not count panels.

name: ctrl_z
text: lol you say "delectable spiced meat"

name: satyr
text: Yes. Yes, he does.

name: skiddyfisk
text: Alt text: mah-'toor, 'eye-talyun

name: cdl146
text: If I could talk like Uncle Culpepper without looking like I get most of my calories from Bert and Ernie dolls , I totally would.

name: cdl146
text: Damnit, my code is a dog's code. Here is what I was trying to link to.

name: closefriend
text:
So this means that Sondra Smuckles started as Sondra Culpepper, a belle of Southern extraction who fell prey to the charming ways of the Man With the Blood on His Hands.

This is going to be just like Biff in that Back to the Future cartoon, a Smuckles ancestor for every occasion!

name: taiiga
text: use of the word conscripted is RAW

name: drycup
text: I do, I say, I do declare I would feel uncomfortable addressing such kin in that there thong garment.

name: jyuu
text: Uncle Culpepper is obviously not so easily flappable.

name: achilleselbow
text: I was tempted to somehow connect 'flappable' with the preceding reference to a thong in the form of some witty double entendre, but then I thought better of it.

name: heccibiggs
text: ..Can it really be done? I can't quite think of a way to make it work.

name: dangelder
text: Think of Paris Hilton in just a thong, walking around, flappable in the wind.

name: thatcrazycommie
text: Next time I order a pizza, I hope to use the phrase "confederacy of additional vegetables."

name: presterjohn
text:
The fact that Uncle Culpepper pronounces the 'ed' in 'parched' as a separate syllable rocks.
Onstad rocks for knowing how to convey this.

name: unsentletter
text: Oh! So that's what that mark means...  hmm!  Excellent.

name: jonnay
text: This is my second favorite story arc.  Let it be known.

name: dumase
text:
It wasn't too long ago that having a pepperoni pizza, with vegetables compromised its purity.
The south sure has come a long way.

name: bixschmix
text: I am in the south, and I still prefer my pepperoni pizzas unsullied by the compromise of additional vegetables. (Extrapolate nothing from this statement; sometimes a pizza's just a pizza.)

name: charchar
text:
I am from the South, and I talk like Uncle Culpepper when I am drunk. And I am always angered and dismayed when nobody applauds my vocabulary.
As far as pizzas, I feel the pepperoni was some erstwhile wayward delivery boy.

name: heccibiggs
text:
Oh man that is awesome.

I am from South London and I too dislike vegtables on my pepperoni pizza.

name: fuzzyshoo
text: oh man i would love to see someone from england transplanted into the southern US

name: i_love_kate
text: I am relatively sure that there are romantic comedies to this effect.

name: alzuna
text: This will probably make me sound terrible uncultured but the Southern gentry type of speech always makes me think of the movie 'O, Brother Where Art Thou' and in particular that bible salesman character, Big Dan...Man, I love that movie.

name: unsentletter
text: This may not make the most sense... but I can't read about Uncle Colonel Culpepper without my thoughts occasionally tracing back to one (quarterback) Daunte Culpepper .

name: neonaoneo
text: 5'd purely because it was genius the way he made me know that Culpepper pronounced Italian with the I rhyming with eye

name: stagnantdisplay
text: Uncle Culpepper is the kind of guy that says Suh instead of Sir.

name: stagnantdisplay
text: Oops, didn't see the one where he calls Little Nephew "young suh". Which is funny, because I was also thinking that he is the kind of guy that would say "I demand satisfaction", which he also says to Little Nephew.

name: mrclumpy
text: It's like an affectionate parody of 19th-century writing and a wonderful example of the same in its own right.

name: carlyle
text:
I expected some kind of friction between Ray and his uncle.

Ray wears nothing but a thong, glasses and some medallion thing. Culpepper is like Epitome of High Society.

name: icecube
text: Blood is thicker than water it would seem.

name: anzio
text: I have actually been mildly confused by this comic. Culpepper notes that Ray looks like his grandfather from his mother's side of the family, when it has become clear that every Smuckles male looks essentially the same, glasses included. So both of Ray's grandfathers happen to look alike? I guess that makes sense, all cats more or less look the same. Did I... answer my own question? I do not know.

name: jamb23
text: Out of interest, do people from the (Deep) South really say "confederacy" in every day conversation out of the context of The Confederacy, as in panel five? If so, I like it. It's a bit like how people in Britain use empire in everyday conversation, e.g. "That lady had an empire of buttocks!" (note: no-one in Britain does this).
